clinical_study.brief_title: Utility of the Smart Pilot View in Clinical Practice: A Two Center Prospective Observational Study
clinical_study.official_title: Utility of the Smart Pilot View in Clinical Practice: A Two Center Prospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: Recently, a new software program for anesthesia has been developed, called Smart Pilot View. This program monitors the patient, the anesthetic drugs given, and the calculated depth of the anesthesia. The purpose of this study is to determine whether the use of this program improves the quality of anesthesia.

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 week From start of induction until discharge from post-anesthesia care unit (PACU)
primary_outcome.description: Anesthesia Quality Score (AQS) is defined as the percentage of time the BIS is within the range of 40-60 AND the mean arterial pressure is within the range of 60-80 mmHg.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 week From start of induction until discharge from post-anesthesia care unit (PACU)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean intra-operative Noxious Stimulation Response Index (NSRI)
secondary_outcome.description: The Noxious Stimulation Response Index (NSRI) is based on a hierarchical interaction propofol-remifentanil model. With this model, the predicted propofol and remifentanyl concentrations can make a prediction about a respons to a certain stimulus, such as shaking and shouting, or a noxious stimulus.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of doses of vasoactive substances
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 week From start of induction until discharge from post-anesthesia care unit (PACU)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of doses of vasoactive substances given to maintain an adequate perfusion pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of events with motor and vegetative (tearing, sweating) responses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 week From start of induction until discharge from post-anesthesia care unit
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of events in which the patient displays vegetative reactions such as tearing and sweating, in respons to a noxious stimulus during surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Recovery times (skin closure to extubation; skin closure to orientation)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 week From end of surgery (skin closure) until discharge from post-anesthesia care unit (PACU)
secondary_outcome.description: The time it takes for the patient to recover from anesthesia: the time from skin closure until the patient is sufficiently awake to be extubated, and the time from skin closure until full orientation of the patient.

secondary_outcome.measure: Early postoperative pain control measured by visual analog scale and total morphine dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 day From end of surgery (skin closure) until discharge from post-anesthesia care unit (PACU)
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the adequacy of pain control during the early postoperative stage, measured by the visual analog scale and the total dose of morphine immediately postoperatively and during PACU stay.

secondary_outcome.measure: Workload of anesthesist, measured by the NASA Taskload Index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 1 day From start of induction until transportation to PACU
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the workload the anesthetist experiences while working with the Smart Pilot View

arm_group.description: Baseline group in which patients are anesthetized without the use of Smart Pilot View, according to common practice.
Study group in which patients are anesthetized with the use of Smart Pilot View.

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing surgery under general anesthesia scheduled for neurosurgery, gynecology and ear nose and throat surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Elective surgery
- General anesthesia
- American Society of Anesthesiologists Physical Status: I - III
- Age 18 to 90 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Combined regional and general anesthesia
- Expected surgery duration < 30 minutes
- Central nervous system (CNS) diseases (dementia, cerebrovascular accident, seizures, psychiatric diseases)
- Regular intake of CNS active drugs (benzodiazepines, antidepressants, antipsychotics, anticonvulsants)
- Heart surgery on cardio-pulmonary bypass
- Relevant hepatic disease (Child B or higher)
- BMI >35
- Overt signs of alcohol abuse
- Contraindications or allergies to drugs used in the study
